column5: This could be a sensitive topic for some people so im sorry if I offended anyone.  The one fish I want to catch before the day comes is gotta be a muskie that I can mount on my wall.  My biggest is 44", but I think a 50" would get on there.  A 6+ pound bass is another one that I would like to get.  What about you guys.
I don't it's that sensitive, for me a 5pb resident brown trout, a 8lb brook trout, 30lb steelhead, 9lb largemouth and a 55" musky (dream big or go home  )
You fellas are too young to be thinkin about bucket lists.
is there a known expiration date or our we just talking bucket list fish ..
Im good for along time. Terry caught his first steel head (with me any ways) Long life to come for us both.
Why dont you have yer steel head in that sig,bud?
You don't have to keep a fish to have it on your wall... Replica mounts look better anyway.   Right now I am looking for that 50 lb Georgian Bay musky. Broke the 40 lb mark when I was 14 lol.

Thats the way to go brother.  Take a few pictures and do a few measurements and watch her swim away.  I still have my gramas bass that she got mounted 30 years ago on my wall.lol  I think I was 14 when I caught my first, but it was only 39".
I think that answered my question. Ha ha . I apologize if this actually the first time you have heard about replicas, and instantly changed your attitude
I wasnt talking to you.  Sorry dude
I WASNT WORRIED ABOUT ME,(NEWFS HAVE BACKS LIKE A DUCK,) LOL.BUT YER INSAULT TO BLADEBURNER.     IS WHAT I WAS REFERRING TOO. Dont bring personal family into it.
Well this escaladed rather quickly.  Back on topic.  Blue Marlin. I don't care how big.
Thought you were looking for a crappie? LOL Their still there J.

Haha I get em in summer in quinte pretty good. And I will have one before ice out this year. That being said, if I never catch one again until the day I'm called by my ancestry to the afterlife I think I'll be ok......... I think.
Unbelievable.  Good luck on your quest, Mr. Musky.
